intro: Acmella debilis, commonly known as the small pink shieldflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, colorful flowers that resemble tiny shields. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowers are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value due to their vibrant colors and unique shape. Acmella debilis is also known for its medicinal properties in some traditional herbal practices.
